data.title: Grandchildren of Eleanor of Aquitaine
data.meta_description: With some assistance from the genealogists on soc.genealogy.medieval, here's the listing of Eleanor of Aquitaine's grandchildren, as accurate and full as I can make it. By Louis VII, King of France, Eleanor was mother of: MARIE (1145-1198) She married Henri I, Count of Champagne, in 1164 1.…
data.text:
With some assistance from the genealogists on soc.genealogy.medieval, here's the listing of Eleanor of Aquitaine's grandchildren, as accurate and full as I can make it.

By Louis VII, King of France, Eleanor was mother of:

MARIE (1145-1198)

She married Henri I, Count of Champagne, in 1164

1. Scholastique of Champagne (died 1219), married Guillaume V, Count of Macon

2. Henri II, Count of Champagne (1166-1197), married Queen Isabella of Jerusalem

3. Marie of Champagne (died 1204), married Baldwin I, Emperor of Constantinople

4. Thibault III, Count of Champagne (1179-1201), married Blanca of Navarre

ALIX (1150-1197/1198)

She married Thibault V, Count of Blois, in 1164

1. Thibault (died before 1190)

2. Louis I, Count of Blois (died 1205), married Catherine of Clermont

3. Henri (died before 1190)

4. Philippe (c.1184-1202)

5. Marguerite of Blois (died 1230), married (1) Otto II, Count of Burgundy, (2) Gauthier II, Seigneur of Avesnes

6. Isabelle of Chartres (1180-1247/1248), married (1) Sulpice of Amboise, (2) Jean de Montmirail

7. Alix of Blois, abbess of Fontevrault

By Henry II, King of England, Eleanor was mother of:

WILLIAM, COUNT OF POITIERS (1153-1156)

HENRY THE YOUNG KING (1155-1183)

He married Marguerite of France in 1172

1. William (born and died 1177)

MATILDA (1156-1189)

She married Heinrich der Lowe, Duke of Saxony & Bavaria, in 1168

1. Heinrich I, Palatine Count of the Rhein (1173-1227), married (1) Agnes of the Rhein, (2) Agnes von Wettin

2. Lothar (1174-1190)

3. Otto IV, Holy Roman Emperor (1175-1219), married (1) Beatrix of Swabia, (2) Marie of Brabant

4. Wilhelm, Duke of Lüneburg (1184-1213), married Helen of Denmark

5. Richenza-Matilda of Brunswick (died 1213), married Geoffrey III, Count of Perche

RICHARD I, KING OF ENGLAND (1157-1199)

He married Berengaria of Navarre in 1191

Illegitimate issue:

1. Philip (f.l. 1201), married Amelie of Cognac

GEOFFREY II, DUKE OF BRITTANY (1158-1186)

He married Constance of Brittany in 1181

1. Eleanor, Fair Maid of Brittany (1184-1241)

2. Maud of Brittany (1185-before May 1189)

3. Arthur I, Duke of Brittany (1187-1203)

ELEANOR (1161-1214)

She married Alfonso VIII, King of Castile, in 1170

1. Berenguela of Castile (1180-1244), married Alfonso IX, King of Leon

2. Sancho (born and died 1181)

3. Sancha (1182-1184/5)

4. Urraca of Castile (1186/7-1220), married Alfonso II, King of Portugal

5. Blanche of Castile (1188-1252), married Louis VIII, King of France

6. Fernando (1189-1211)

7. Mafalda (1191-1204)

8. Constanza (1195-1243), nun at Las Huelgas

9. Enrique I, King of Castile (1204-1217)

10. Leonor of Castile (1208-1244), married Jaume I, King of Aragon

JOAN (1165-1199)

She married (1) William II, King of Sicily, in 1177

1. Bohemond, Duke of Apula (born and died 1182)

She married (2) Raymond VI, Count of Toulouse, in 1196

2. Raymond VII, Count of Toulouse (1197-1249)

3. Richard (born and died 1199)

JOHN, KING OF ENGLAND (1166-1216)

He married (1) Hawise of Gloucester in 1189

He married (2) Isabelle of Angoulême in 1200

1. Henry III, King of England (1207-1272), married Eleanor of Provence

2. Richard, Earl of Cornwall (1209-1272), married (1) Isabel Marshall, (2) Sancia of Provence, (3) Beatrice of Falkenburg

3. Joan (1210-1238), married Alexander II, King of Scotland

4. Isabella (1214-1241), married Friedrich II, Holy Roman Emperor

5. Eleanor (1215-1275), married (1) William Marshal, Earl of Pembroke, (2) Simon de Montfort, Earl of Leicester

Illegitimate issue:

1. Joan (died 1236), married Llywelyn ab Iowerth, Prince of Gwyneth

2. Richard, Baron of Chilham (died 1246), married Rose of Dover

3. Oliver (f.l. 1218)

4. Geoffrey (died 1205)

5. John (f.l. 1201)

6. Henry (died 1245)

7. Osbert (f.l. 1216)

8. Eudes (died 1241)

9. Bartholomew (f.l. 1254)

10. Maud, Abbess of Barking (died 1252)

11. Isabel, married Richard Fitz Ives, lord of Degembris

12. Philip (f.l. 1263), married Lavinia

For those keeping track, this brings the number of Eleanor's grandchildren to 51. Of these, 13 are illegitimate. There are 21 girls to 30 boys. There are 4 Matildas and variants, 3 Eleanors, 3 Isabels, and 2 Joans. There are 6 Henrys and variants, 3 Philips, and 3 Richards.
